Package Strategy.Algorithms

Class Minimax

  • java.lang.Object
    • Strategy.Algorithms.Minimax
  • public class Minimax
extends java.lang.Object
    A minimax algorithm that can hardly compute the best possible move by brute forcing all possible combinations. Not suitable for the game but useful to find traps that opponent can implement. Also, can be used to find tricky winning moves that MCTS might not recognize.

    The Minimax contains two methods to find best move in a certain depth.

    The Minimax contains one method to calculate the score for the particular combination.

    Since:
    2.0
    Author:
    Denis Krylov
    See Also:
    MonteCarloTreeSearch, Board, Mark

    • Method Detail

      • findNextMove

        public int findNextMove​(Board board,
                        Mark mark)
        Returns the best possible move on the current board and selected mark. Represents the recursive tree with selected depth that plays all possible combinations N moves forward (N equals depth). Because this function was optimised to work together with MCTS, it returns a winning move or, if the move wasn't found, an empty array.
        Parameters:
        board - current board
        mark - selected mark
        Returns:
        winning move or an empty array

      • minimax

        private int minimax​(Board board,
                    Mark mark,
                    int rotation,
                    int depth,
                    int alpha,
                    int beta,
                    boolean maximizingMark)
        A minimax function itself. It puts a player's mark if maximizingMark is true and opponent mark if maximizingMark is false in all possible sells with all possible rotations.

        If depth for particular combination is 0 tries to evaluate the score by calling calculateScore function. If the player is winner returns positive score, if opponent is winner returns a negative score.

        If depth is not 0, change the value of maximizingMark to opposite and perform the same operations simulating the game from the opponent's side.

        Parameters:
        board - current board
        mark - selected mark
        rotation - selected rotation
        depth - computational depth
        alpha - best evaluation for the player
        beta - best evaluation for the opponent
        maximizingMark - current player to compute (opponent if false)
        Returns:
        score of the move

      • calculateScore

        private int calculateScore​(Board board,
                           Mark mark)
        Computes the score of the position as following:
        • if the player is winner : +1
        • if the opponent is winner : -1
        • if there is a tie : 0
        Parameters:
        board - current board
        mark - selected mark
        Returns:
        score
